content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Prompt is a bit of a read but explains the puzzle well, also short coding time  leading to a good clash of code

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: je trouve l'énoncé bien adapté à un clash : un peu long à lire, mais relativement simple à résoudre ce qui laisse du temps pour écrire un code aussi court que possible

Hello
Maybe you could add tests and validators for desired temperature equal to MaxTemp or MinTemp
for now, both solutions returning "dirty hands!" or leftDeg  succeed

The idea should be fine, and I'd further suggest to include [[Temp]] greater than [[MaxTemp]] or [[MinTemp]] (requiring output of e.g. {{IMPOSSIBLE}}) so that conditions will be an element of the clash.

Goal section
* Suggest to rewrite as follows:

You are going to wash your hands with water at the desired temperature of [[Temp]]. As you rotate the tap handle, the temperature of the water is adjusted uniformly:
• You increase the temperature if you rotate the handle counter-clockwise, with the maximum temperature of [[MaxTemp]] reached when the rotation is [[LeftDeg]] degrees.
• You decrease the temperature if you rotate the handle clockwise, with the minimum temperature of [[MinTemp]] reached when the rotation is [[RightDeg]] degrees.
Output the degree of rotation of the handle that gives you water at the temperature of [[Temp]].

Input section
* Please add line numbers and variable descriptions for each line.

* Please change "place" to "places".

* Please change "have" to "are floats with".

Output section
* Please add "at the temperature" between "water" and "you".

Stub generator
* Please be reminded to include a write statement.

Thanks.

Thanks very much, now I will add test cases.
Take a look at the stub generator now please :)

Thanks, I will keep that in mind.
And good luck with the third solution :D

[[Edit]] Done!

Translation:

"I find the statement well suited to a clash: a little long to read, but relatively simple to resolve, which leaves time to write code as short as possible"

Comment: Thanks very much!

Looking good. Below are my comments on the updated clash:

Goal section
* Suggest to add a blank line before "Output" for clarity.

Input section
* Please change "[[Deg]]" to "degrees of rotation" (twice) (because [[Deg]] in the context of the statement refers to the answer).

* Please add line numbers in <<bold>> (e.g. <<Line 1:>>).

Constraints section
* Please add:
  • [[LeftDeg]] > 0
  • [[RightDeg]] < 0

Cases
* Currently only one validator requires a positive output. It would be better if one of the other validators be changed to also require a positive output.

Thanks.
I did already, is it good now?
